laboratory_examinations.findings: All patients were heterozygous for the Avellino dystrophy gene.
Granular deposits were observed centrally in the interface beneath the flap of both eyes, more numerous in the right than the left.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: 14 months after surgery, white opacities noted in the interface.

laboratory_examinations.findings: 20/30 in the right eye and 20/40 in the left eye.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: BSCVA decreased as the number and density of the opacities increased.

laboratory_examinations.findings: MR was /H110023.25/H110020.50/H1100340 in the right eye and /H110022.50/H110021.00/H1100390 in the left eye.

laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Decreased to 20/50 in the right eye and 20/200 in the left eye 26 months after LASIK.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Manifest refraction was /H110021.00/H110011.00/H1100385 in the right eye and /H110021.00/H110010.75/H11003115 in the left eye.
Numerous fine, white, granular deposits were noted in the right cornea.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Deposits in the right cornea were more numerous than in the left; 24 months after LASIK.

laboratory_examinations.findings: The cornea was nearly clear, except for the preexisting granular opacities.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: BSCVA of the left eye improved to 20/20 without recurrence of opacities.

laboratory_examinations.date: One month after removal of the opacities
laboratory_examinations.findings: Contrast sensitivity returned to normal in the left eye.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: BSCVA decreased to 20/50 in the left eye 16 months after removal.
